alert.note: Alert for Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 2:24PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...An area of showers will cause strong southwest winds for portions of west central Utah County through 315 PM MDT... At 222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers with strong gusty winds near Vineyard, or 11 miles west of Provo, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Southwest wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Provo, Orem, Lehi, Spanish Fork, Springville, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Mapleton, Salem, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Benjamin, Palmyra, Lake Shore, Utah Lake, West Mountain and Saratoga Springs. These showers will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Utah Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 253 and 272. US Route 6 between mile markers 174 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
